solitude module¶

class solitude.Factory(cfg)[source]¶

Bases: object

Create a Factory object

The Factory object can be used to create pre-configured objects from a solitude configuration dictionary.

Parameters:cfg – solitude configuration dictionary
create_client(endpoint=None) → solitude.client.eth_client.ETHClient[source]¶

Create a ETHClient object, used to interact with an ethereum node.

Parameters:endpoint – if set, it overrides the Client.Endpoint setting in the configuration
create_compiler(add_contract_dir=False) → solitude.compiler.compiler.Compiler[source]¶

Create a Compiler object, used to compile contracts with solc.

Parameters:add_contract_dir – whether to load contracts from the directory specified in Compiler.ContractDir or not
create_linter(add_contract_dir=False) → solitude.compiler.linter.Linter[source]¶

Create a Linter object, used to invoke solium.

Parameters:add_contract_dir – whether to load contracts from the directory specified in Compiler.ContractDir or not
create_server() → solitude.server.rpc_server.RPCTestServer[source]¶

Create a RPCTestServer object, used to start a ganache test node.

have_tool(name: str) → bool[source]¶

Check if a tool is installed

Parameters:name – name of the tool
solitude.read_config_file(path: str)[source]¶

Read a solitude configuration from yaml or json file.

Parameters:path – path to configuration file
solitude.write_config_file(cfg: dict, path: str)[source]¶
solitude.make_default_config()[source]¶
